channel.title: Npc Drops (turning off..)
channel.description:
okay well on my server after about 30-60 minutes the drops turn off... i dont want to restart it to fix it.. i want at least an effeciant way
DOES ANY1 HAVE A COMMAND/FIX FOR THIS?
idk if its a command or not, il try and implant the comand to activate cuz i think its an exception that destroys the drops, so i need something that will restart the drops/turn them back on
help apreciated (rep fo yew!)

item.title: Npc Drops (turning off..)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

public static int[] globalItemID = new int[####];

That means that #### items will drop before items stop dropping.

item.title: Npc Drops (turning off..)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

amg jc… i hope ur smart… while i was adding the resetitemdrop void… i noticed tihs…

[code] public void process() {
for (int i = 0; i <= 5000; i++) {
if (globalItemID[i] != 0)
globalItemTicks[i]++;

		if ((hideItemTimer+showItemTimer) == globalItemTicks[i]) {
			if(!globalItemStatic[i]) {
				removeItemAll(globalItemID[i], globalItemX[i], globalItemY[i]);
			} else {
				misc.println("Item is static");
			}
		}

		if (showItemTimer == globalItemTicks[i]) {
			if(!globalItemStatic[i]) {
				createItemAll(globalItemID[i], globalItemX[i], globalItemY[i], globalItemAmount[i], globalItemController[i]);
			} else
				misc.println("Item is static");
		} 
		
	}
}[/code]

does that have something to do with items turning off? amg i am so fucking happy… PLEASE TELL ME THATS WAT I NEED TO REMOVE!

Read full topic

item.title: Npc Drops (turning off..)
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Try this code -

if(command.startsWith("resetdrops")) { ItemHandler.resetItemDrop(); yell("Drops are now reset and working!"); }

Then, in your ItemHandler class search for -

public static int[] globalItemID = new int

You should see something like this -

public static int[] globalItemID = new int[####];

Change the #### to a higher number such as 2000000.

Then, again, in your ItemHandler class, find this -

public static void resetItemDrop() {

You should see something like this -

public static void resetItemDrop() { for(int i = 0; i <= ####; i++) { globalItemID[i] = 0; } }

Make the #### 1 less than your other value that you edited earlier. (2000000 would be 1999999)

If you don’t have that method, add it somewhere in your ItemHandler class.

Reply with any concerns.

Read full topic
